entry.title: How to Cut Video using VLC Media Player
entry.content:
Hey folks ! It happen many times at the time of watching a video or movie we like some part of it for example a songs, some great seens from the movie, comedy acts etc and we want to separate out that part from videos easily, in simple words it is called as video cutting. 

Generally people use various softwares for video cuting, but I’m here to tell you that, to cut a small segment of a video you don’t have to install any software program on your computer system. For doing this, all you need is just VLC Media Player which I think everybody have on their system.

 

How to Cut Videos Using VLC Media Player

Step : 1. Play the video in VLC player and click on <strong>View</strong>then select <strong>Advanced Controls</strong>.

Step : 2. Now you can see some extra icons just above the Play/Pause button at bottom left corner. The first button from left is the Record button, just go to that point from where you want to cut a video then click on Record Press it again to stop recording.

 

After you finished cutting the video clip, you can find those clip in your “Documents” or Video folder named as VLC Record with the date and time. This is the best and simplest way to cut video, so from now whenever you find any seen great in a movie use the tool.

entry.title: How to Secure Facebook Account
entry.content:
Facebook is the best social networking site, king of Social Networking, need of every Internet user and we can say The Heart beat of  Youth, in short Facebook is most popular and all we great people knows that the most popular thing is always favourite of evils, I mean evils always have their eye over it.

Now Imagine if someone steal your Heartbeat ! no no not in real actually I’m talking if someone hack your Facebook Account, this will be a worst news for anyone I think, nobody wants to loose Facebook account because it is the best way to communicate with near and dear, friends, Girlfriends/boyfriends and many others, I’m just trying to tell importance of Facebook in one’s life and I think this is now a very important part of everyone who use Internet regularly.

 

Facebook always tries to secure all your data in the best possible way, but the black hat hackers are always searching for the loop holes to get access to the unrestricted data.

 

Do you know facebook has how many users, Facebook has one billion users, out of which a recent study said that about 10% accounts are fake which simply means, over 900 million users share their life on Facebook, but most of the people deosn’t enabled the security features provided by Facebook which cause really serious problems sometime.

 

I’m sure you are one of those who share personal life on Facebook, tell me have you enabled your Facebook accounts security settings, most probably your answer will be No ! so I’m going to share most important facebook security tips which surely help you to stay safe over Facebook.

 

Tip 1 to secure Facebook Account

You must have heard about https, https is more secured than http. https is a communication protocol for secure communication over a computer network. Hence it is always recommended to have an https protocol while surfing on Internet. Every Facebook account has an option of secure browsing, but when we create account on fb it is disabled by default. So all you need to do is enable it!

 

Let me tell you the way How to Enable this security setting

  1. click on the down arrow next to the home button then click on the account settings.
  2. click on security at left hand side.
  3. Now in the security settings, click on the very first option named Secure Browsing.
  4. Click on check button in front of  browse Facebook on a secure connection (https) when possible and click on save changes.

 

See the picture below to get what I’m talking about easily 

Now onwards when you browse on Facebook you will have a secured communication!

 

 

Tip 2 to secure Facebook Account

You may know that Gmail has a 2 Step Verification security setting. I personally using this and found it as the best way to secure my account. Now Facebook also providing same way to secure your accounts. With the help of this setting, when you login to Facebook from a different place other than your regular IP, you will receive a text notification on your cell phone/email and it will be very easy for you to know the unauthorized access to your Facebook account.

 

To enable this great security Setting on Facebook, Follow these simple steps

  1. Open Account Setting (same page which you opened before).
  2.  Click on Security at left.
  3. Now click on the second option named Login Notification.
  4. Click on Check button and Fill all the required data (Password and your mobile No.)

 

See the picture below to get what I’m talking about easily

Note : Faceook will take sometime to send you varification code so wait a while, don’t be get frustrated after all it’s the matter of Security.

 

Please let me know if you find these tips helpful, I hope now you feeling more secured to use your Facebook account. If you have any query or suggestion please comment. Have Fun :)

entry.title: How to Access Multiple Facebook Accounts in a Browser
entry.content:
Is Accessing multiple Facebook account through same browser simultaneously possible ? May be you are thinking this, after reading the title of this post. so let me tell Oh Yeah… this is possible and it’s very easy too.

 

Many time when we are using Facebook account we have to open another account so for this we generally use any other browser, but now you won’t need this, here is the solution of this problem, Go through this post and you will get it very easily.

One and only requirement for this scheme is that you should use Google Chrome browser, so install the Google Chrome if you are using any other and follow these steps..

 

1. Open your facebook account by the same way you log into your account normally i.e. by filling your User ID and Password on facebook homepage now you are logged in.

 

2. Now we need to open another account in same browser then Right Click on Facebook icon at top left corner and just click on Open link in Incognito window. like shown in picture below

 

 

3. After clicking on Open link in Incognito window a new Facebook login page will be open in same browser fill your another User ID and Password and enjoy the experiment ;)

 

What is Incognito Window 

In Incognito window any data, website  or Pages you view won’t appear in your browser history or search history, and they won’t leave other traces, like cookies, on your computer after you close all open incognito windows. but any files you download or bookmarks  will be preserved.

 

May be this scheme is also working with other browsers too, but I haven’t tried this so I suggest you everyone to try it with all the browsers you are using, and also share with us if it is possible with any other.

entry.title: What are cookies and how to use them in PHP ?
entry.content:
What is a cookie

A cookie is a small file that we create on user’s computer. Almost every website we visit on internet create and save many cookies on our computer for different purposes.

 If we think our websites as a building, a cookie can be understood as an ID card that is given to every person to distingush that person from all the others who enter the building (visit our site).

 Use this firefox addon. Install it, and then open from Tools>Cookie Manager+. It will show you all the cookies that are present in your browser and you can also edit and delete cookies with this.

Use this addon for debugging your application (i.e. to see whether the cookies are really set and with what values).

 

 Why we use cookeis

Cookies are used to save information. That information can be anything. It’s usually used to save information that is used to identify a user across different pages. For example, when you login to Facebook, it save many cookies to save information to identify you. (use cookie manager+ to see that yourself. Delete all cookies, then login to fb and see how many and what information it save in cookies).

Basic purpose is to identify the user who has logged in.

 

How to use cookies

We use setcookie() php function.

It has following syntax:

 

setcookie(name, value, expire, path, domain);

Here,

  1. name is the name with which cookie is saved in browser
  2. value is the value of cookie saved
  3. expire is the expiration time stamp
  4. path is the path on your domain to which the cookie is available
  5. domain is domain which can access the cookie (it is your site by default)

 

Just take care of the ‘expire’ parameter. It is a timestamp (like Sept 9, 2012 6:11AM), not how much time to expire the cookie (like 2 hours). People often get confused with this. We use time() function to know current server time, and then add no. of seconds after which it’ll be expired in it. e.g.

 

setcookie(“TestCookie”, $value, time()+3600);  / expire in 1 hour /

 

Here

  1. "TestCookie" is the name of cookie
  2. $value is the information we want to save in that cookie
  3. and third parameter is the expiration time

Information we want to save is kept in the ‘value’ parameter.

Go here (official php documentation) for complete information.

 

How to Retrieve Information from Cookies

Everything we save in cookies is simply available in $_COOKIE[‘cookie_name’] array.

 Do you know : The way to Access Multiple Facebook Accounts in Same Browser

 

How to Use cookies in real world

When the user successfully login to your site, set a cookie with some unique identifier that’d help to identify that user all over the site. We do that by setting a cookie with a value that’s unique for every user, like their user_name or user_id (this approach is actually not at all safe, I’ll tell you why in a min). And then when user visit the profile page, read the cookie data and show different pages for different users.

Here’s a little example meta-code:

 After a user successfully logs in, execute this code and redirect user to wherever you want (may be their profile page)

 

if(login == 'successful') {

  setcookie("authenticated", "true", time()+3600);

 setcookie("user_id", "9", time()+3600);

}

 

And then on user.php page, fetch the data for user with user_id 9.

i.e. SELECT * FROM users_db WHERE user_id= $_COOKIE[‘user_id’]

 

But this approach is not safe. Anyone can change the user_id value in cookie (with addons like above) and access other users' data. Simplest way to avoid this is by ‘not’ using cookies for login data. Sites like facebook use cookies, but they use complex algorithms to make them secure.

 

Use session variables instead of cookies. Sessions are stored on server, so they are not directly accessible to user and hence offer more security.

For example, after a successful user login:

 

if(login == 'successful') {

 $_SESSION['logged_in'] = true;

 $_SESSION['user_id'] = $user_id;

}

 

and they can be accessed as regular php variables after that. On user.php page, just check if user is ‘logged_in’ and

fetch his personal data from database:

 

if($_SESSION['logged_in'] == true) {

 SELECT * FROM user_db WHERE user_id = "$_SESSION['user_id']"

 

This approach is safe

 

In short,

  1. Use cookies for saving non critical data (not needed in your project)
  2. Use $_SESSION variables for checking the logged_in users

And if you want to use cookies anyway (for learning or whatever reason you have),

  1. Set cookies when user successfully log in with setcookie()
  2. Set a cookie with a value that will uniquely identify a user (like his user_id)
  3. Use those cookies (with $_COOKIE['cookie_name']) wherever you need, like on user's profile page

Same goes for the session variables.

entry.title: Tutorial To Understand 'COOKIES' Better
entry.content:
In our post “What are cookies and how to use them in PHP ?” we said in the last of  post that ‘Nothing teaches better than a quick tutorial’. So here’s one.

I hope you have already set a php development environment. If not, learn how to do it on Linux here.

 

We’ll make three files in this tutorial.

  1. login.php: Page with login form
  2. login_proc.php: Page with code to set cookies on successful login
  3. user.php: User profile page that’ll use information set in cookies

 

login.php

<table>

<form action="login_proc.php" method='post'>

<tr>

<td>

  <lable for='user_name'>Enter your Name</lable>

</td>

<td>

  <input type="text" name='user_name'>

</td>

</tr>

<tr>

<td>Password</td>

<td>

  <input type="password" name='passwd'>

</td>

</tr>

<tr>

<td>

  <input type="submit" value='Log In'>

</td>

</tr>

</form>

</table>

 

Nothing to explain in this file. Just a simple form

 

login_proc.php

 

<?php

if($_POST['passwd'] == 'root'){

setcookie('name',$_POST['user_name'], time()+3600);

header("location: user.php");

}

else{

header("Location: login.php");

}

?>

 

This code check if password was right (here you put your login validation logic) and sets a cookie with name ‘user_name’. In real world projects, here come the user_id or unique user_name (actually in an encrypted form so that user don’t access other users’ accounts by changing cookie values().

 

user.php

 

<?php

echo "<h1>Hello ".$_COOKIE['name']."</h1>";

?>

 

Here is the code of user’s profile page. Not much in this example. But in real world, use cookie variable to identify the user and show him a custom profile page (with his personal information).

 

Above tutorial was just an illustration of how to deal with cookies. Hope you liked it, click share please.. :)
